body.name: Cadco OV-013 Half-Size Countertop Convection Oven, 120v
features: KITCHEN ESSENTIAL - The Cadco OV-013 is a heavy-duty oven with a sturdy stainless-steel construction, ensuring durability and reliability. Its heavy-duty door and hinge construction further enhance its robustness. Equipped with a high-temperature ball-bearing motor, this oven is designed for long-lasting and consistent performance. The reinforced door design adds an extra layer of strength, making it ideal for commercial or heavy use.

COOK TO PERFECTION - A smart choice for any commercial kitchen that requires high-quality and efficient cooking. The oven has a heavy-duty squirrel cage fan that circulates more air in less time, resulting in uniform and rapid cooking. The oven also has manual controls that allow you to set the time, temperature and heat settings to suit your preferences. You can select from 175O to 500O F to perform various cooking functions, such as baking, roasting, broiling or warming.

CAPACITY - The Cadco OV-013 oven has a spacious cooking chamber that can accommodate up to three half size sheet pans. The dimensions of the cooking chamber are W: 18-3/4” x D: 13-3/4” x H: 9” (1.34 cu. ft.), which gives you enough room to cook large batches of food. The oven also comes with three wire shelves that can be adjusted to different positions.

SAFETY - The Cadco OV-013 oven is not only efficient and durable, but also safe and comfortable to use. The oven has a “cool-touch" double wall glass door that prevents heat from escaping and protects you from burns. The oven cavity is wrapped in high “R” value insulation that keeps the oven temperature stable and reduces energy consumption.

WARRANTY - Cadco, Ltd. warrants all products (in the U.S. only) to be free from defects in material and workmanship for a period of one year from date of purchase. Warranty does not apply in cases of misuse, abuse, or damage from external service or repair attempts by unauthorized personal. (Residential Usage: Cadco assumes no liability for parts or labor coverage for component failure or other damages resulting from installation in non-commercial or residential applications.)
body.description: The Cadco OV-013 countertop convection oven is constructed of stainless steel—a durable, rust-resistant metal that's simple to clean. It features a double-wall, insulated glass door that remains cool to the touch to prevent injury, and its high-temperature ball-bearing motor ensures lasting performance. To adjust the unit's temperature and time settings, operators can use the manual controls. It's also equipped with an end-of-cycle buzzer to alert users cooking is complete. For countertop placement, the Cadco OV-013 electric convection oven measures 235⁄8 inches wide by 233⁄4 inches deep by 153⁄4 inches high. It accommodates three half-size sheet pans and has a temperature range of 175 to 500 degrees Fahrenheit. To promote fast, even baking, it features an advanced airflow design with a heavy-duty squirrel cage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great secondary oven for baking
reviews.reviewText: OVEN REVIEWI operate a small cottage bakery and needed an additional oven to expand my baking opportunities. Purchased end of September 2021 and has been in use since. So far, this oven has met all of my requirements. There will be a small learning curve, but that is to be expected with any new oven. Temperatures and timings will need to be reconsidered – keep notes!!!PROSThe oven heats up quickly, about the same as my 30 inch oven. It retains heat reasonably well – takes a short while to come back up to temperature after loading all three racks. You need to load quickly to not lose too much heat.Not as loud as other reviewers have stated. About the same as my Kenmore (cheap) dishwasher.Alarm beeps 15-16 times and then shuts off. Alarm is not extremely loud or annoying, but you know when it times off!Bakes evenly on all three levels/shelves. There appears to be a cooler spot on the left rear position. I rotate the pan(s) half way through baking to get even cooking/browning.Nice that it operates on standard household current. The cost to install another 240V line was a major deciding factor in my choosing this model.Footprint is not too large. Only takes up a 2 foot square area. Think large microwave.The outside of oven does get hot, but not too hot.Interior is easy to clean.BAKE TEST RESULTS.18 sourdough bagels (6 per sheet/5 ounce each) takes about 15-18 minutes at 425-450FSix 8 inch focaccias (2 pans per shelf) bake in 20-25 minutes at 425-450FBrioche loaves (two 5x10 inch pans) bake in 35 minutes at 300-325FEveryday sandwich loaves bake in 30-35 minutes at 325FCONSAfter 2 months of use – none so farNOTESBetter to use a nonstick silicone baking mat instead of parchment paper. The paper does get blown around by the fan.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great purchase experience. The oven works as advertized
reviews.reviewText: The wife uses this oven for home baking. She loves it, especially the option to use the timer or constant oncontrol. It was well packaged. The shipping method seemed a bit extreme using XPO logistics to ship sucha light package arriving by tractor trailer delivery. But still ordering and shipping was a breeze.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Se daño en el primer uso.
reviews.reviewText: Hice bread Pudding a 270 grados F, a mitad de cocción el ventilador se detuvo y el horno lo sirvió más. La primera vez que lo usé.Es ruidoso, la ventilación es siempre de 100%. En el caso que no se dañe la primera vez que lo uses, este horno MO SIRVE para todos los productos de pastelería. La ventilación es exagerada. Y NO TIENE luz.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for a small business. One of the best 110v options to avoid having to change basic electrical amperage and outlet. I have reliably baked many different things in this oven. Note: for For French Macarons and other fan sensitive pastries, you will need to consider buying the fan deflector. Very happy with it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2020
reviews.reviewText: The new version of this oven now has an alarm that sounds like an air raid for 15 seconds every time it is turned off!That's not all, while its running the fan now has a snorkel that makes it sound like a wood chipper. So loud!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice, overall, but not a great home oven
reviews.reviewText: I've had a 1/4 size Cadco, which I bought used, in my kitchen for a few years now. Aside from the fan dying (easy to replace), it's been a great little oven. So, when it was time to get one for my bakery, I looked to Cadco again because I like that it was available in 120V and the price/performance has been solid. This newer, bigger oven is nice, but I'm not quite as crazy about it.Pros:* 120V, so you can use it in more places without wiring hassles* 3 racks with plenty of space for cookies or other flat items* Cooks evenly* The marks in the thermostat dial are too close together. I worry that I when I try for 300, I could be getting anything from 285-315.* The fan is very strong and very loud. I used this at home for awhile, and it was too loud for my home kitchen. In the commercial kitchen, it's no problem. It's much louder than my old 1/4-size oven, though not as loud as the ancient full-size ovens at the bakery where I used to work.* It beeps incessantly when the timer runs out. It's loud and screechy and goes on and on and on. The thing is, if you turn the timer dial the other direction, where it stays on until you turn it off, it also beeps and beeps and beeps when you turn it off. Totally unacceptable for home. To work around this, I set it to stay on and then hooked it up to a power strip with a switch on it and used the switch to turn it on and off.* The racks seem to wander. My counter is level, but one or two racks will gradually vibrate their way forward. They then touch the door and make a loud buzzing noise. All this movement and noise is driven by the vibration from the fan.Three of these four downsides are not a big deal in a commercial kitchen, but are kind of deal-breaker for home use. So far, the thermostat issue seems like it'll be ok for what I make, but I'd consider the digital model if I was buying again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Oven shipped timely and works great
reviews.reviewText: This is the second oven I have purchased of the same exact one. The first is five years old for us and purchased used. It had an element blow out and is getting older so I purchased a new one. Used for several hours 5 days a week and works great

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2017
